intro: Oxythece glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth oxythece, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Oxythece glabrescens is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
